channel.title: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper
channel.description:
Well, I gave Kubuntu another shot (got pissed off a while ago because I couldn't get internet to work) but I still get errors when installing ndiswrapper. Here they are:
[code]towelie@riprsc:~/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52$ sudo make make -C driver make[1]: Entering directory `/home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver' make -C /usr/src/linux-headers-2.6.22-14-generic SUBDIRS=/home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver make[2]: Entering directory `/usr/src/linux-headers-2.6.22-14-generic' LD /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/built-in.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/crt.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/hal.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/iw_ndis.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/loader.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/ndis.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/ntoskernel.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/ntoskernel_io.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/pe_linker.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/pnp.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/proc.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/rtl.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/wrapmem.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/wrapndis.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/wrapper.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/usb.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/divdi3.o LD [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/ndiswrapper.o Building modules, stage 2. MODPOST 1 modules CC /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/ndiswrapper.mod.o LD [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/ndiswrapper.ko make[2]: Leaving directory `/usr/src/linux-headers-2.6.22-14-generic' make[1]: Leaving directory `/home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver' make -C utils make[1]: Entering directory `/home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/utils' gcc -g -Wall -I../driver -o loadndisdriver loadndisdriver.c loadndisdriver.c:15:20: error: stdlib.h: No such file or directory loadndisdriver.c:16:19: error: stdio.h: No such file or directory loadndisdriver.c:17:19: error: errno.h: No such file or directory loadndisdriver.c:18:20: error: string.h: No such file or directory loadndisdriver.c:19:20: directory loadndisdriver.c:27:19: error: fcntl.h: No such file or directory In file included from /usr/lib/gcc/i486-linux-gnu/4.1.3/include/syslimits.h:7, from /usr/lib/gcc/i486-linux-gnu/4.1.3/include/limits.h:11, from loadndisdriver.c:28: /usr/lib/gcc/i486-linux-gnu/4.1.3/include/limits.h:122:61: error: limits.h: No such file or directory loadndisdriver.c:34:25: error: linux/major.h: No such file or directory loadndisdriver.c:35:25: error: linux/ioctl.h: No such file or directory In file included from loadndisdriver.c:37: ‘sscanf’ loadndisdriver.c:590: warning: implicit declaration of function ‘closelog’ make[1]: *** [loadndisdriver] Error 1 make[1]: Leaving directory `/home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/utils' make: *** [all] Error 2 [/code]
What am I doing wrong? My problem was that I have an Atheros 5007eg or whatever wlan card in my laptop. Supposedly it gives troubles to many people.

item.title: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I joined the kubuntu forums and asked the same question. They told be to install build-essentials so I did, and so I was able to use ‘make’. Then I installed ndiswrapper, but after a while it still didn’t work. I still had a folder with the install shit for madwifi, so I did that and now it works. Thanks Rictoo! Thing is, I can’t find the envelop with my wlan key so it still doesn’t work, but it does identify my wlan. Everyone thanks for helping.

Read full topic
item.source: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper

item.title: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

You guys are all fucking idiots. I answered his question in the second post. Atheros cards do not, I repeat, do not use ndiswrapper on linux; they use a seperate driver called madwifi.

Read full topic
item.source: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper

item.title: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Ubuntu is the only distro I know that dosen’t allow you to install the main headers (and glibc-dev!) by default.

GG Ubuntu, you are now worthless.

Read full topic
item.source: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper

item.title: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

This is what I get when I do ls -l /usr/src/linux-headers-2.6.22-14:

towelie@riprsc:/$ ls -l /usr/src/linux-headers-2.6.22-14
total 128
drwxr-xr-x 28 root root  4096 2007-10-17 00:09 arch
drwxr-xr-x  2 root root  4096 2007-10-17 00:09 block
drwxr-xr-x  2 root root  4096 2007-10-17 00:09 crypto
drwxr-xr-x  7 root root  4096 2007-10-17 00:09 Documentation
drwxr-xr-x 66 root root  4096 2007-10-17 00:09 drivers
drwxr-xr-x 62 root root  4096 2007-10-17 00:09 fs
drwxr-xr-x 43 root root  4096 2007-10-17 00:09 include
drwxr-xr-x  2 root root  4096 2007-10-17 00:09 init
drwxr-xr-x  2 root root  4096 2007-10-17 00:09 ipc
-rw-r--r--  1 root root  1530 2007-07-09 01:32 Kbuild
drwxr-xr-x  5 root root  4096 2007-10-17 00:09 kernel
drwxr-xr-x  5 root root  4096 2007-10-17 00:09 lib
-rw-r--r--  1 root root 50403 2007-10-15 00:33 Makefile
drwxr-xr-x  2 root root  4096 2007-10-17 00:09 mm
drwxr-xr-x 41 root root  4096 2007-10-17 00:09 net
drwxr-xr-x  9 root root  4096 2007-10-17 00:09 scripts
drwxr-xr-x  4 root root  4096 2007-10-17 00:09 security
drwxr-xr-x 18 root root  4096 2007-10-17 00:09 sound
drwxr-xr-x  2 root root  4096 2007-10-17 00:09 usr

Read full topic
item.source: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper

item.title: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

did you try ‘ls -l /usr/src/linux’? (that’s a lowercase L)
and i think you’ll have to do ‘ln -s /usr/src/linux /usr/src/linux-2.x.x.x’, but you’ll see when you try it

edit: another indicator for whether the symlink is there or not, is just trying to cd into it

Read full topic
item.source: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper

item.title: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Ok, I’ll see if there is a symlink. If there isn’t how do I create one?

Like this: ln -s /usr/src/linux linux-2.xx.xx (xx.xx being the kernel version)?

Edit: ls -L /usr/src/linux didn’t work, because that file doesn’t exist. So I tried ls -L /usr/src/linux-headers-2.6.22-14 wich gave me a list of folders, like usr and makefile, but not something like lrwxrwxrwx 1 root root 12 Oct 13 11:04 /usr/src/linux -> linux-2.6.22-14.

Read full topic
item.source: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper

item.title: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

yes, however, do a ‘ls -L /usr/src/linux’, so we know where the symlink points to.
if it doesn’t point to anything, it’d simply mean creating the symlink, and it should work

edit: it should give an output like this:

lrwxrwxrwx    1 root   root    12 Oct 13 11:04 /usr/src/linux -> linux-2.6.24-r5

if it doesn’t output something like that, try ‘ls -l /usr/src/linux’, as i’m not 100% sure on the switches

Read full topic
item.source: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper

item.title: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I’ve found this site: https://code.launchpad.net/linux-kernel-headers/+download

That should be it right? I probably need the top one which is a 5.5mb .tar file.

Edit: where do I extract it to? I tried root/system/sys/kernel but it won’t allow me, even if I open it as root. When I open the folder as root it says that it can’t make the files, and when I open it normal it says I’m not allowed to.

Edit2: I found out that I have to put it into usr/src/linux, but there are already two folders called linux header 2.6.22.18 and linux header 2.6.22.18 generic ( I’m not sure if it is .18 or something else, but that doesn’t matter atm) Are those the kernel headers or not?

Read full topic
item.source: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper

item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

How would I access a repository with Vista? AFAIK you need a packet manager to access them, but then again I’m new to Linux.

package manager*
I believe there is a web interface for the archive at http://archive.ubuntu.com

item.title: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

the only solution i can think of would be to install the kernel headers (i think you can get them from a repository), then extract it in the right place, and try it again

Read full topic
item.source: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper

item.title: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper
item.dc:creator: @kloplop321 kloplop321
item.description:
@kloplop321 wrote:

yeah the “download from sourceforge and compile yourself” thing did not work for me, so you can use adept, or the synaptics package manager to install the binary nidswrapper for you, works fine some cards require blacklisting, and mine must be in when the computer boots, and cannot be pulled out during runtime of the system or it crashed and does not respond at all. Otherwise it works quite well

Read full topic
item.source: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper

item.title: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper
item.dc:creator: @sppt sppt
item.description:
@sppt wrote:

i think you’re missing your kernel headers, since it can’t find the default headers like stdio.h and string.h
only way to fix it would be to get the kernel headers, which is rather annoying without internet.

Read full topic
item.source: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper

item.title: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper

item.description:

Don’t compile them? I know there’s a binary download for ndiswrapper.

item.title: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

All Atheros cards use Madwifi, not ndiswrapper. If you don’t have net access on your Ubuntu box, get the appropriate package for your arch at http://packages.ubuntu.com/feisty/net/madwifi-tools, otherwise ‘apt-get install madwifi-tools’.

Read full topic
item.source: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper

item.title: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Well, I gave Kubuntu another shot (got pissed off a while ago because I couldn’t get internet to work) but I still get errors when installing ndiswrapper. Here they are:

towelie@riprsc:~/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52$ sudo make make -C driver make[1]: Entering directory `/home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver' make -C /usr/src/linux-headers-2.6.22-14-generic SUBDIRS=/home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver make[2]: Entering directory `/usr/src/linux-headers-2.6.22-14-generic' LD /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/built-in.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/crt.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/hal.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/iw_ndis.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/loader.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/ndis.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/ntoskernel.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/ntoskernel_io.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/pe_linker.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/pnp.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/proc.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/rtl.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/wrapmem.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/wrapndis.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/wrapper.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/usb.o CC [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/divdi3.o LD [M] /home/towelie/Desktop/ndiswrapper-1.52/driver/ndiswrapper.o Building modules, stage 2. make: *** [all] Error 2

What am I doing wrong? My problem was that I have an Atheros 5007eg or whatever wlan card in my laptop. Supposedly it gives troubles to many people.

Read full topic
item.source: Errors when trying to install ndiswrapper
